subject: Creativity
title: Creative People Are Messy: Disorder Doesn't Equal Genius
description: Learn Creative People Are Messy: Disorder Doesn't Equal Genius in one minute.

hook.text: Einstein's desk was famously messy. So people assume messy = creative. But Einstein also had a rigid daily routine.

buildup.text: One study (Vohs, 2013) found messy rooms boosted creative thinking slightly.

discovery.text: Follow-up studies show the effect is tiny and inconsistent. What messy desks actually signal is low conscientiousness.

climax.text: Creativity requires both generation (messy thinking) AND execution (organized doing).
